revised_title: Terrane Accretion and Tectonic Development of the Cordillera of Western North America
tldr: This article discusses the accretion and tectonic development of the Cordillera in western North America, focusing on the accretion of various terranes, including oceanic island arcs, seamounts, and continental fragments. The article highlights the challenges in determining the origin and genetic linkage of these terranes and emphasizes the importance of paleogeographic and paleobiogeographic studies in understanding their accretion history.
